Comment: There’s a reason the civil right movement focused on Rosa Parks and not Claudette Colvin.
Author: umassmza

Comment: I can assure you it wasn’t because of her criminal record or perceived criminal record. Also…  Colvin was one of four plaintiffs in the first federal court case filed by civil rights attorney Fred Gray on February 1, 1956, as Browder v. Gayle, to challenge bus segregation in the city. In a United States district court, Colvin testified before the three-judge panel that heard the case. On June 13, 1956, the judges determined that the state and local laws requiring bus segregation in Alabama were unconstitutional.  So…. In the end— everyone. Not just one person. Everyone.
Author: Mr_Horsejr
